(Contorted Dominion SPLIT/BORON)The Split have chosen to maintain this sector as little more than a trench upon which to launch further attacks against the Boron in nearby sectors. Boron incursions are routine, as they struggle to regain control. There is little here that does not involve war or conquest.

(Faded Dreams SPLIT/BORON)The Boron colonised this sector with dreams of such magnificence even the Queen offered her blessings. Flourishing for a great while, such dreams indeed became reality until the Split discovered and gained control over the connecting sector. Trade turned to war and dreams once cherished were left faded and broken.

(Queen's Harbour BORON)Specialising in food and power storage technology, Queen's Harbour offers a wide array of wares. It is used as a re-supply point for many major passenger transports, and on occasion, the Queen's own personal carrier.

(Menelaus' Oasis BORON)Once a haven for the Queen herself, Menelaus no longer retreats here in times of trouble. Conflict in nearby sectors has borne a wealth of agriculture, high-tech goods and military hardware needed to supply the war front.

(Vestibule of Creation PIRATE)Once thought by the Paranid to be a portal to the Ancients, such beliefs were quickly quashed in the realisation that Pirate signalling beacons were the cause of their delusion. After an embarrassing retreat, this sector became the domain of the lawless.

(Thyn's Excavation SPLIT)Holding the Strong Arms HQ, Thyn's Excavation provides funds and resources for the ongoing conflict in Veil of Delusion. Naturally this has extended to arms shipments wherever else they are needed. For the Split, the price of war is never too high.

(Veil of Delusion PIRATE)This sector began life in relative peace, both sides sharing resources equally. Open conflict between the Split and Boron soon changed that. Now a mire of lawlessness, the Boron no longer have the resources needed to simultaneously engage both Pirate and Split forces.

The discovery of this intriguing sector has been a welcome distraction for the neighbouring Argon, who are facing conflict. Each star in this trinary system has a distinctively different composition as well as a very active solar cycle. Initial attempts to build stations in this sector failed when violent solar activity forced an evacuation. The lone planet is a barren world, gravitationally locked with the central star. Studies of its surface will hopefully answer questions about this sector's past and suggest colonisation options for the future. The Argon Government has warned against building new stations or visiting in modestly-shielded ships, for fear of another solar event. Some entrepreneurs, looking to exploit the energy of the suns, have completely ignored any warnings.

Clear Homebase for All Ships in Wing
Set as Homebase for Other Ships

page.title: Command Info
page.t: Command this ship to attack any enemies that come within 10km of a specified sector position.\n{2022,99992}

This command will initiate the ship's jumpdrive sequence. A jumpdrive and energy source must be onboard. Any escort ships attached to the primary target will also attempt to jump and fly to the same target sector.
Equip a ship and all its followers with a certain amount of a ware in range.\n{2022,99992}
Buy missiles for a ship and all its followers, as set in the missile resupply settings.\n{2022,99992}
Buy enough energy for a ship and all its followers to jump to a specified sector.\n{2022,99992}
Fly around and buy ship equipment to equip a target ship exactly like a source ship is equipped.\n{2022,99992}
Map a known sector and add every discovered object to the sector map.\n{2022,99992}
Mine and Trade Minerals: Mine minerals and sell for maximum profit.\n{2022,99993}
This command prompts for a sector. The ship will begin patrolling this sector, engaging enemies as it goes.\n{2022,99988}

This command causes the ship to patrol all of the sectors in the patrol list. Patrol lists may be defined when starting the command. Each sector in the list is visited and quickly scanned, and enemies are engaged. When the ship completes all sectors in the list, it returns to the first sector and begins again.\n{2022,99988}
Scout for enemies in a specific sector and report if an enemy is spotted.\n{2022,99992}
Mine Minerals: Mine minerals and sell them to a station. Type of debris, amount to mine and station to sell the minerals to can be changed.\n{2022,99993}
Attack all enemies. Prefer Capital Ships.\n{2022,99992}
Send boarding pods or marines to board a ship.\n{2022,99994}
Command this ship to collect an astronaut. As a passenger of your ship, he can then be enslaved and sold to pirate bases, released to freedom or trained as a marine.\n{2022,99993}

Select the station and product to buy, then select the station to sell the product at.\nYour ship will then purchase as much of the product as possible at the first station and sell as much as it can at the second station.\n{2022,99992}
Buy as much as possible of the specified ware for the best possible price in the specified jumprange.\n{2022,99992}
Sell the specified cargo for the best possible price in the specified jumprange.\n{2022,99992}
Start in the specified sector. Take passengers needing a ride to their destination station.\n{2022,99993}
Fire all missile turrets on target.\n{2022,99993}
Activates the unfocussed jumpdrive to jump to a random sector\n\nWARNING: Sectors can be uncharted and possibly dangerous.{2022,99994}
Activates the unfocussed jumpdrive to return back to where you jumped from originally.{2022,99994}
Dock at selected station and fight off all attackers.\n{2022,99993}
A report listing all the ships heading to this station, found within a 9 sector radius.\n{2022,99992}
Deploy fighters and retreat from the battle area.\n{2022,99992}
Retreat from the battle area without reacting to any more assaults.\n{2022,99992}
Launch all docked fighters that do not have a command, to attack all enemies around the mother ship.\n{2022,99993}
This command will help to defend a selected sector from a possible invasion. The ship will attack all enemy ships/stations found in the sector until they are all gone.\n{2022,99994}

Two modes of operation are available for this command.
The first allows you to scan large asteroids in a sector, to discover their yield content for mining.
The second mode surveys the asteroid debris in a sector and reports back the type of ores likely to be yielded from mobile mining the sector.
{2022,99992}

This command will use your available freight drones to transfer freight to and from a target ship/station.\nAllows you to select what wares to send from your ship, and what wares they should return with from the target.\n{2022,99994}
Command a Freight drone to drop off its freight.\n{2022,99994}
Command a Freight drone to fetch freight from a target ship.\n{2022,99994}
This command allows you to quickly launch marines at your chosen target.\n{2022,99994}
This command allows you to buy a ware from a selected station\n{2022,99994}
This command allows you to sell a ware to a selected station\n{2022,99994}
Turret command to target missiles, and missiles only. Will not attempt to shoot at any ships even when under attack.\n{2022,99994}
Turret command to target fighters, so it will only try to shoot at fighters, ignoring freighters and larger ships.\n{2022,99994}
Turret command to target capital ships, so will only try to shoot at larger vessels, ignoring freighters and fighters.\n{2022,99994}
Select a target ship and a station where those ships should meet. They will both move there and, upon arrival, swap their pilots.\n{2022,99994}
This command transfers money from the station account to your account. The money is transferred every minute if the specified limit of the station account is exceeded.\n{2022,99990}
\n\033B STL Software Development and Modification\033X\n\033BArgon Prime\033X

page.title: Command Info
page.t: Command this wing to dock either at its homebase, at your target, at a station or on a carrier.\n{2022,99994}
Command this wing to fly to a sector.\n{2022,99994}
Command this wing to fly to a given position in a sector.\n{2022,99994}
Command this wing to attack all enemies in sector.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to attack an enemy.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to follow another ship.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to protect another ship or station.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to attack the same target as another ship.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to attack the enemy nearest to a ship or station.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to attack all enemies that get too close to a specified position.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to stop any movement.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to jump to a destination.\n{2022,99994}
Command this wing to assemble in one sector and start moving around there.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to patrol several sectors.\n{2022,99993}
Command this wing to collect all wares in a sector.\n{2022,99993}
Order every ship to resupply with jumpdrive energy and missiles.\n{2022,99992}
Order every ship to buy the same equipment that one specified ship has.\n{2022,99992}
Order every ship to refill their missile supply.\n{2022,99992}
Command this wing to take down a target ship's shields to prepare for boarding.\n{2022,99994}
Command this wing to return to the wings default homebase.\n{2022,99994}

page.title: Encyclopedia Texts
page.t: Select a category for more details
Select an item from the list to display details
Sold as Products at Known Stations
Bought as Resources at Known Stations

Today, the Argon Federation is wealthy and encompasses a large number of very different types of planets. Some are deserts while others are icy wastes. The planet Argon Prime is the heart of the Federation and is the seat of the government and all other administration. It is also one of the most exciting planets in the X Universe. Not only is it the home of culture, science and learning, one can also find the finest entertainment. In addition to the finest Geodesic Holiday homes it also offers thousands of bars, restaurants, theatres, casinos, holosuites, cinemas, holiday villas, everything, in fact, that makes it the finest rest and recreation centre in any known universe.\n\nThe Argon Federation is governed by an elected parliament. Each city, colony and space station represented by senators elected by their electorate. The leader of the Argon Parliament is called President. Currently, a male Argon called Frann Herron holds this position.

The Argon build the most balanced ships in the X-Universe. One can see the Boron influence that mirrors their joint development. When you buy an Argon ship you get a good all-around, versatile vessel. In addition, since the Argon do not share the peaceful nature of the Boron, you may be able to install the Mass Driver Gatling gun. This weapon was developed according to specifications found in some old documents. The Split were so impressed by this weapon that they paid enormous licensing fees so that they could manufacture it as well.\n\nWith the development of the Nova, an M3 class fighter and successor of the aging Elite, the Argon were the first race to install a rear turret in a heavy fighter. Technologically advanced shipyards enable the Argon to build better ships by increasing shield capacity and improving engine performance. Whereas, in the past, you may have laughed about the old Elite, it is a different story today. Although the Nova is still one of the slowest heavy fighters, her fire power will quickly silence any critics. Similar upgrades were installed in the Buster, an M4 fighter, and the newly introduced Argon Centaur Corvette, while the Elite has since been redesigned and brought back into service.

The Boron are famous for their wisdom, wealth and the sophistication of their space ships throughout the X Universe. Boron ships have a shimmering green tint to them. They are equipped with powerful engines and are among the fastest and most manoeuvrable ships in the universe. They are also armed with very sophisticated weapons and defensive shields and, with the exception of the Argon, are among the best spacecraft you can buy.

Because of their peaceful nature the Boron are friends to all races in the X Universe despite their membership in the Foundation Guild and their strong alliance with the Argon. They currently hold trading agreements with both the Teladi and the Paranid, however, they are still very wary of the Split and relationships between the two races are strained.

The Boron have no direct contact with the Xenon, however, because of their relationship with the Argon, they are very much aware of them and of the threat they represent. Despite being called the Kingdom of Boron, they are actually ruled by an elected government. They do however have a royal family who act as figureheads of the Kingdom State.

The current head of this Royal Family is the 50-year-old Queen Atreus. Her husband, King Rolk, was killed in a space cruiser when it crash-landed on a nearby space station, leaving their daughter, Princess Menelaus, as the heir apparent.

In the past, the Boron have cooperated very closely with the Argon design engineers even though their aggressive nature was never fully understood by the Boron. The constant threat of assault from the over aggressive Split has pushed more recent Boron ship designs to move away from their peaceful nature. Advanced Ion weaponry and unique propulsion systems have led to a drastic reduction in raids by Split pilots. When compared to Argon ships, the new Boron ships are just as fast and with equivalent armament but with weaker shields.

To this day the Split continue to control large territories that used to belong to the kingdom of Boron. They continue to exploit the rare Markus Spacefly as a propellant in their ships but they also continue to effectively trade with the Profit Guild. While the relationship between the Foundation Guild and the Profit Guild remains cordial, on the surface anyway, the relationship between the Split and the other races is continually degenerating and now borders on the edge of war. This due equally to the natural aggressiveness of the Split and the continued abuse of the Markus Spacefly.\n\nEven though the Boron are a peaceful race, they are always eager to reclaim their lost territories and don't miss any opportunity to attack the Split. The Argon are suspicious of the Split's alleged friendship with the Xenon even though the Split and Xenon barely tolerate each other. They were at war at one time but when neither side could see an easy victory or any territory to be gained, they came to terms. However, this treaty is very shaky and a new war is expected if their association deteriorates much further. The Split maintain a frosty friendship with the Paranid but will never forgive them for not engaging in the fight against the Xenon when the Split needed them.

The Split firmly believe in the axiom that if you can't eliminate your enemy with the first shot, get a bigger gun or get more support. They are impatient and have an insatiable need to be the first to join any conflict. In ship construction, therefore, shields take a backseat. In one particular construction project, shields were retrofitted because they were left out in the design. Their engineers still complain about it today, citing a missed opportunity to fit the ship with more weapons.

Nevertheless, Split ships are some of the best combat ships built. If you are willing to live with weaker shields then you trade that for the strongest and deadliest weapons.

It was with extreme reluctance that a few Split traders had Ion Disrupters fitted into their cargo bays only to discover that they could use them to hunt Spaceflies. That is why the Split personnel transporters, the most luxurious and lavishly outfitted ship used for hunting parties, can be fitted with the Ion Disruptor.

The Paranid are allied with the Split even though there have been many disagreements between them. They are also allied with the Teladi because both races are members of the Profit Guild. For this reason the Paranid allow all other races to trade freely throughout their territory. However, because of strained relations between the Paranid and the Argon, trade is the only contact these two races have with each other. They adhere strictly to their ancient and strange rites and religious beliefs which are a mystery to other races. It is virtually impossible to befriend or even understand them. Their religion also forbids non Paranid to settle or live in a Paranid colony. This law is really of little consequence because very few outsiders are interested in settling in Paranid colonies. This is due to the fact that the Paranid prefer to settle on planets that are much too hot and humid for other races.

The Paranid have always understood how to construct good combat ships. They have the best fighting capabilities of all the fleets in the X-Universe. Unfortunately, their designers have little imagination and only required functionality is added to their ships. Comfort is discarded for more practical amenities. But, if you are looking for a ship that will still be intact after a heavy skirmish, a Paranid ship would make an excellent choice.

It was Paranid engineers who developed the Phased Shockwave Generator and the Fragmentation Bomb Launcher. Both of these weapons are designed to have a wider area of fire than your standard issue laser.

The Paranid were forced to sell the designs of the Particle Accelerator Cannon to the other races during their recent recession which some have said, with much sneering, was caused because of the small cargo bays in their ships. The sale of plans for any future weapons was prohibited by the Paranid secret service.

Most of the races in the X Universe don't like the Teladi and refer to them as greedy and lazy. Sometimes they are even referred to as stupid but that is only by races that have never done business with them. The Teladi drive some of the hardest bargains in the X Universe and always come out of a situation with a profit. This is the primary reason why certain races have banned the Teladi from trading in their territories or sectors. Consequently, the Teladi are always on the lookout for new trading partners. It is believed that they finance many of the pirate factions that operate throughout the X Universe. Indeed, many races believe that it is no coincidence that their ships have been captured and their high-tech equipment looted by pirates after refusing to trade with the Teladi.\n\nTheir own technology tends to lag behind the rest of the occupants of the X Universe but, being Teladi, they would rather buy and trade for what they need than spend their money in research and development. Hence, the Teladi have access to all the high-tech equipment, engines and weapons technology of practically all the other races.

The skill of the Teladi is not the ability to sell water to a Boron swamp runner, as is claimed by some, but rather the ability to adapt anything they can lay their claws on. Their own technology is pretty much outdated and since they prefer to trade rather than develop, they manage to use most anything in their ships. Consequently, when looking at their fleet, they have the broadest spectrum of upgrades, weapons and shields. Their ships move rather slowly in comparison to others but with lots of cargo space and strong shields. You should not underestimate them.

Their combat ships are usually late on the scene but when they do get there they are usually efficient in their job.

Since the Teladi have friendly trade relations with all organic races, including the Pirates, they can usually rely on their help if attacked. There is currently a rumour about a new Teladi M6 prototype which is said to be better equipped than anything seen so far. At a secret trial run the Split, supposedly trying to attack the ship with two of their own M6 class ships, were so impressed by it that they decided to forego their usual ridicule of its snail-like speed.

Today, the Xenon are somewhat of an enigma. There is no known contact between the Xenon and any other race. They do not belong to any of the guilds. They do not use Credits nor is it known what, if any, currency they use. They appear to have no interest in the technology of or to trade with other races. The location of the Xenon home planet, if there is one, has never been discovered in spite of many attempts to do so. Nor does anyone know the exact size of the territory that the Xenon control. Hence, on most star maps, possible Xenon sectors are only marked with a question mark and a warning to be cautious. Not many ships dare venture into these regions of space and, regrettably, many ships brave enough to do so have never been heard from again. The Xenon, if the robot psychologists are to be believed, seem to be ever increasing in self awareness, consciousness and understanding of themselves. Whether this development is a step in the right direction is still undecided since the Xenon continue to attack first and don't bother asking questions afterwards.\n\nA special covert operations department of the Argon Federation Space Academy based on Argon Prime has researched the Xenon for many years and is currently engaged in documenting and cross referencing all confirmed Xenon ship sightings. Unnamed sources inside the department suggest that there are plans to finance an undercover expedition deep into the Xenon territory in an attempt to locate the Xenon home world.
Xenon ships are very aggressive. Their only directive is "If it moves, shoot it down". They are fast, heavily armed and well protected.

The Kha'ak is a hive race in which the individual only exists to serve the hive. A Kha'ak will sacrifice himself to that end without question. The Kha'ak's goal appears to be the destruction of the universe. They employ a cluster configuration in which their interceptors, scouts and fighters group together and break apart at will in order to better engage the enemy. Despite their increasing presence in the universe there is still very little known about them; their origin, how many of them there are or what their true intentions are, although there are rumours linking them with Nividium.\n\nIt is interesting to observe how Kha'ak ships behave. If you have ever seen a flock of birds suddenly change direction you might agree that it's an amazing sight. Kha'ak fighters emulate this behaviour when they chase a patrol ship. Once their target is destroyed they will turn as one and take on their next victim. You may see this yourself one day and your reaction will change very quickly from fascinated amazement to gut-wrenching horror when you realize that you are their next chosen victim. The Kha'ak turn everyone and everything they encounter into space debris. They take no prisoners.
Their ships are of an unusual pyramid shape and resemble crystalline structures.

Pirates are not a race in themselves but groups of like-minded criminals who specialize in all sorts of illegal activities. They have their own bases, usually hidden from view and well defended. Most pirate bases have large fleets of ships and will send out raiding patrols on a regular basis. They are known to be very aggressive and if they spot you across the sector they may start heading your way. If you encounter pirates, you can report them after you have scanned a pirate ship for illegal goods with you freight scanner. Note: you can't see what's in the cargo hold without first scanning the ship and that scanning is illegal if you don't have a local police license.

You will encounter pirate vessels of all types since pirates use other races' ships, modified for their own ends. The wealthy pirate groups even have their own custom ship designs, often including non-standard ship colours.\n\nDo not confuse pirates with smugglers who are much cleverer by using normal ships to conceal their activities.

Seven hundred years in the past, Earth colonists were trapped in the X-Universe. They made a new home on the planet now known as Argon Prime. At the same time, the terraforming Xenon machines took over the sectors east of President's End. Most of these became Pirate sectors after the Xenon war.

The Argon called the colonists Gunners, naming them after their leader, Nathan R. Gunne who explored the universe in an effort to find a way back to Earth. The details of their story became obscured in the centuries that followed and became known as The Truth. Even their name became distorted and they became known as the Goners. The Goners worked in harmony with the Argon and spread the "good news" about the existence of a glorious planet called Earth to other races.

Goners use the "Book of Truth" as their spiritual and philosophical guide and in their temple they have "Beholders of the Truth". Their leader is Noah Gaffelt, an old man with a white beard. Norma Gardna, a noted female Beholder of the Truth and second in command, died on Argon Prime due to a sickness and was replaced by Lynda North. The "Book of Truth" is said to contain extensive knowledge about Earth, which has found itself in high demand due to recent events.

While the Goner Ranger was the only ship known to be in use by the Goners, with their growing needs and numbers following the recent "rediscovery" of Earth, there are rumours of larger Goner ships. Due to their extremely peaceful nature, Goners ships are totally unarmed. The Ranger is quite fast and is also considered to be a good short range freighter due to its large cargo space. It is also capable of carrying shields compatible with some M3 fighters. You will probably see this ship roaming all sectors spreading the word of the Goners and Nathan R. Gunne.

The Terrans are the inhabitants of Earth. They are a technologically advanced race, but their suspicion of other races, including their lost cousins, the Argon, motivated them to be protective of their territory.
To shield Earth from alien races, they moved their only jump gate to a secluded location and a substantial military presence now buffers the void between the Solar System and the Commonwealth.
The Terrans built only two jump gates, all other gates were built by a mysterious people only known as "The Ancients".
In the year 2066 \(Earth date\) the Terrans started to send terraforming ships into the depths of space.
These were later followed by self-replicating machines. After several years the terraforming project was discontinued but their attempts to cancel the terraforming process failed because the terraformers had become sentient and the machines became known as the Xenon.

Several years after that, the Xenon attacked the Earth and tried to destroy their creators and everything they stood for. This was the Xenon invasion. In a brave tactical manoeuvre, Nathan R. Gunne led the Xenon fleet through a jump gate to what is now known as Brennan's Triumph. He then destroyed the gate that led back to Earth. He would never see his home planet again.

The ruthless Yaki pirates have taken advantage of the weakened Argon fleet to carry out raids on Argon facilities and many other sectors in the X-Universe. The Yaki Pirates are becoming a real force to be reckoned with. Their activities have all the hallmarks of deliberate creation of chaos and confusion in order to undermine law and order throughout the universe. They are known for their frequent attacks on isolated traders because they are easy targets, often without fighter escorts.

page.title: Basic Patrol Messages
page.t: You have to provide me with a list of sectors to patrol if you want to issue the Patrol Multi-Sector command. The command to define a patrol route is in the [yellow]Additional Ship Commands[/yellow] area of the command console.
My Patrol List currently only contains one sector: [yellow]%s[/yellow]. If you only have one sector you'd like me to patrol, the Patrol Single Sector command should be used.

I regret to inform you that I have been waiting for [yellow]%s[/yellow] of my wingmen to show up for quite some time. You might want to check the patrol route, but I fear the worst. I cannot afford to delay the patrol anymore. I am forced to continue on.
[author]%s[/author][text][center][red]I've been detected.[/red]\nRequesting immediate assistance in sector [yellow]%s[/yellow][/center][/text]
[author]Factory Incoming Ships Report[/author][b]Begin order report for [green]%s[/green]:[/b]\n
%s is %s jumps away in Sector %s;\n Order: %s %s\n
%s is %s jumps away in Sector %s;\n Delivering: %s %s\n

This is patrolship: [yellow]%s[/yellow] from your station: [yellow]%s[/yellow].
As a result of severe hull damage I have left the patrol and flown to station: [yellow]%s[/yellow]
I await your orders.

page.t: [author]Ships Computer[/author][text colwidth='370']%s units of %s has been bought from %s at %s[/text]

[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370']What do you think this is, a Mammoth? I can only carry up to %s sized containers. %s comes in %s only.[/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370']Sorry, looks like someone beat me here. The price has gone down past the %sCr I paid for the %s.[/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370']There doesn't seem to be anywhere I can buy any %s round here.[/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370']There doesn't seem to be any stations that want any %s in these parts.[/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370'][yellow]%s[/yellow] would only take some of the %s. I still have %s units left.[/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370']Did I miss something? [yellow]%s[/yellow] has disappeared![/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370']What did you do to upset the %s? [yellow]%s[/yellow] has just denied me docking permission![/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370'][yellow]%s[/yellow]? You want me to go there?! I thought the %s were the enemy?[/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370'][yellow]%s[/yellow] doesn't want any of that![/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370']And just how am I supposed to get to [yellow]%s[/yellow]?[/text]
[author]MTC: %s[/author][text colwidth='370']Sorry, looks like someone got here first. The price here is not as good as I was expecting for %s.[/text]

page.title: Intro Menus
page.t: Defend the Sol system from alien threats, use your advanced combat training to survive in an unforgiving new universe and find both friends and foes in the Commonwealth.
Privileged enough to be born on Earth itself, you abandoned your wealthy lifestyle in search of excitement and adventure in a military career among the stars.
You serve in the Argon military, protecting the Argon race from enemies near and far.

Life was good until you got too greedy and the Profit Guild caught up with your illegal operations. Now you face a race against time to retrieve your specially modified ship before it's confiscated for good.
Shunned by your family, your only chance to regain your empire is to survive the contagious disease that the unholy one gave you.
After hundreds of years, the universe rediscovered, your task is to defend your homeland against the intruders from beyond.
Caught stealing Paranid military secrets and disavowed by your government, your only chance now is to flee these sectors and start anew.
You know the way of the warrior. The Argon and the Paranid must pay for their crimes against your people!
Carrying a contingent of the Boron Royal Family, a jumpdrive malfunction has left you in unfamiliar territory. Can you return the Queen's daughter alive?
After several years of lacklustre trading, you give it all up to relive the glory days. Setting off from the Argon homeworld, you have little more than a basic ship and a thirst for adventure.
\033YWARNING:\033X This game mode is very dangerous. Whatever you do, you can't undo it. Dead is Dead. Proceed at your own risk. Requires connection to Steam.
No connection to Steam is available at the moment. Please reconnect and try again.
Starting a new Dead-is-Dead game will invalidate your existing Dead-is-Dead saved game. All your progress will be lost. Are you sure?

In the Dead-is-Dead game mode, you will not be able to save and reload your game while you are playing. The game is saved automatically when you quit and is tied to your Steam account. Once you load the saved game, it cannot be loaded again. In case of death, you lose all your progress. The Dead-is-Dead game mode can be disabled in the Gameplay menu but cannot be re-enabled. Good luck!
Please wait while preparing the Dead-is-Dead game...
\033YFailed to transmit data to Steam. Retrying...\033X
Failed to transmit data to Steam. Please restore the connection and retry. If you cancel the transmission, your progress will be lost!

page.title: Game Tips
page.descr: Ingame tips for the player that are shown once an action is performed for the first time. The tips should be as short and precise as possible.
page.t: Approach the highlighted docking bay at low speed.
$STATION:$ Select $TRADE$ to buy or sell goods.
Goods marked red are not available to you. Your reputation must be improved.
$PERSONAL:$ All tips can be reviewed under $PERSONAL$ / $ADVANCED$.
$NAVIGATION:$ Select $UNIVERSEMAP$ to display the universe map.
To claim an abandoned ship, approach it in your space suit and select $CLAIM$.
This weapon requires suitable ammunition in the freight bay.
$PERSONAL:$ Select $MYMISSIONS$ to manage all accepted missions.
Fly into cargo containers to pick them up.
Choose the station's position and orientation using the numpad.
To save your progress you need to dock at a station.
The orange arrows point to your current mission objective.
Contact the highlighted ship to start your flight training.
Press $VK_FASTFORWARD$ to activate SETA time compression.
$OPTIONS:$ While docked you can save your game by pressing $VK_SAVEGAME$.
$PERSONAL:$ You can upload your game statistics to the Egosoft website. Select $PERSONAL$ / $ADVANCED$ / $EXPORTSTATS$ from the sidebar.
You can steer your ship in space by pressing and holding down the left mouse button.
You can manually repair ships and stations by using the repair laser in your spacesuit.
After a friendly fire incident you can apologise to the victim.
To collect spaceflies you have to stun them with an Ion Disruptor.
Press $VK_RELVIEW$ in external views to change the camera mode.
You can use the cursor keys to steer your ship. You can also strafe using the keys $VK_STRAFE_UP$, $VK_STRAFE_LEFT$, $VK_STRAFE_DOWN$, $VK_STRAFE_RIGHT$.

page.title: Misc
page.t: The OTAS Corporation welcomes you aboard this station.(speak Oh-Tas)
Plutarch welcomes you aboard this station.
The Nividium Mining and Manufacturing Corporation bids you welcome and profit aboard this station.
Duke's Buccaneers welcome you to this station.
A peaceful welcome aboard this Atreus Shipbuilding Currents station.
Welcome and rejoice in the firepower of Strong Arms!
On behalf of the people of Earth, welcome aboard the mighty Earth Torus.
On behalf of all truth-seekers, welcome to this Goner station.
Welcome aboard this AGI Task Force station.
Welcome aboard this Yaki station, pilot. Enjoy your stay.
(decent non-US pirate voice)Hello, matey. A hearty welcome aboard this pirate station.
In the name of Priest Emperor Xaar, our Priest Duke welcome all friends of the Paranid aboard.
Friends such as you are always welcome on Goner Stations.
The AGI Task Force values friends such as you. Welcome aboard.
Greetings, friend. We bid you a heartfelt welcome to this Terran station.
Welcome to this Yaki station. You are among friends here.
It is a great honour that you wish to grace this Goner station with your presence. Welcome.
It is a pleasure and a privilege to welcome you aboard this ATF installation. Please enjoy your stay.
Heroes of Earth and Sol are afforded a special welcome. Your presence here is an honour.
The Yaki are honoured by your visit to our station. Welcome!
You have the gratitude of pirate brethren.
Be warned - any further hostile act towards us will meet with dire consequences.
You were warned. Pirate ships will hunt you down like vermin.
You have earned the thanks of pirates.
The Goner appreciate your efforts on our behalf.
If you continue your aggressive actions towards our hallowed property, we will be forced to respond.
Defence forces are now being dispatched. They have orders to eliminate hostile threats.
The Goner are grateful for your help.
The Terran people thank you for your help in eliminating this threat.
The consequences of firing upon a Terran facility are dire. You have been warned.
Terran authorities are now launching fighters. They have orders to destroy!
The Terran people owe you a debt of gratitude.
The Yaki thank you for keeping their space clean.
Few survive a direct attack on a Yaki facility. You have been warned.
Yaki fighters are now being launched. They have orders to destroy!
The Yaki are grateful to you.

page.title: Argon/Terran Male Variation 1
page.t: Hey! That had better have been an accident!
I suggest you leave me alone or you'll be sleeping with the spaceflies!
Keep that up and you'll regret it!
Don't say I didn't tell you so! You'd better run and hide!
Someone! Please help! I'm being attacked!
You got the flying skills of a large asteroid!
Argh, I can't take much more of this!
I'll see you on the other side! Arrrgh!
Guess the odds of you winning this... Yep, you lose!
We won't warn you again. Next time you die!
Is there something I can help you with?
Don't you have a sun to fly into?
You picked a bad time, sorry.
You're confusing me with someone who cares.
Is this your stupid idea of a joke?
It's a good day to die!
OK, I give up, I'm punching out... Take the ship!
Here, take this freight and leave me in peace.
Bridge Commander speaking. State your business.
Oh, you want to talk now, do you? Unlucky!
No time to stop and chat; find someone else to annoy.
You must have a comm problem, talk to someone else.
Suh-ren-der?.. That's my line, so get out of here before you die.
Take a look around, wiseguy... You're there!
Sorry, I'm not from around here.
You just need to fly through the
You appear to be carrying contraband. Jettison them or face the consequences.
We won't tell you again. Drop the illegal goods.
No contraband is indicated on our scans. Thanks for your patience.
Notice any extra oxygen consumption on board recently?(sarcastic)
I won't put up with this any longer. Let me off!
That freight has my name on it. Drop it or regret it.
You're more clever than you look.
Now you've tested the release mechanism, drop the rest!
Heeelp! Someone help me deal with this idiot.
You're doing a great job there... I'll just watch.
OK. Help is on the way.
Rolling in to engage the enemy!
The main reactor is just about to go!
How about a space dust diet?
It's locked on me; the missile has a lock!
(generic job)I've got something that might interest you then.
(combat mission)I'm looking for a fighter pilot.
(I need a ship)I need a ship.
(I need some wares)I'm looking for someone to pick up some stuff for me.
I'm looking for a freighter pilot.
(urgent transport)I need to get out of here, fast.
I need someone to build me a station.
(NPC wants some wares or ships)We need you to deliver some items.
I'm looking for someone to work for me.
Yeah, I've got another job for you.
Do you want to see the details?
This might be a bit tricky.
This might prove a hard mission.
This mission should not take too long.
This job might take a while.
You should expect enemies on the way.
Watch out for police during the mission.
Watch out for enemies during the mission.
Thanks, couldn't have done it without you.
(Mission Complete, recurring)Thanks, great work as usual.
(Mission Complete, could be better)Ok, that will do. Could have been better though.
(Mission Failed)That was terrible! Get out of here!
(Mission Failed Mid Mission)This mission is over!
(Time Update)That's it. You're out of time.
(offensive action against mission object or actor)What are you doing??
Sorry, I wanted an experienced pilot.
You need a combat ship for this.
You need a transport ship for this.
You're going to need a jumpdrive.
(Passenger on board)Now get me to my destination!
(No life support)You need a cargo life support system to transport passengers!
(passenger wont slum it in a fighter)I'm not getting on that, get a Passenger Transport.
(Ship has no equipment)Get some equipment installed.
(something is wrong)What do you call this?
Intercept and destroy all hostile ships!
Fall back and regroup at Command!
(reinforcements arriving)Thought we'd drop by to clear up your mess.
Good work, pilot. Proceed to base for repairs.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
(cargo bay full)You need to clear some cargo space.
(want player to dock to get wares)Dock here so I can transfer the wares.
(want player to dock to get info)Not safe to transmit this openly, dock here and I'll send the data.
(player got ship for npc)Dock it here then.
What are you waiting for? Get on with it!
(distance guidance, panicked. Could be a hostile or concerned guide)Get away from it!
(no missions available)Nah, not got anything for you.
(reward for continued service)Your continued service to us cannot go unrewarded. We insist you accept this token of our appreciation.
Our scans reveal you are carrying an illegal passenger. Release this person immediately.
Okay, come back later if you change your mind.
Terracorp is looking for someone to work for us.
Would you like to do some work for Terracorp?
Terracorp would like you accept this token of our appreciation for your continued service.
Please accept this as a token of Terracorp's appreciation of your service.
Jonferco are looking for someone to do some work for us.
Would you like to work for Jonferco?
Please accept this as a reward for your continued service to Jonferco.
Jonferco would like to offer you this for your continued service.
OTAS(speak Oh-Tass) are looking for someone like you to work for us.
Your continued service to OTAS is recognised with this gift.
OTAS offers you this for your continued service.
Plutarch is looking for someone to work for us.
Plutarch has some work for a pilot like you.
Please accept this from Plutarch in recognition of your loyal service.
Plutarch offers you this gift for your continued service.
Spaceweed received, looks like they don't suspect a thing. Now get me those mines so we can get out of this place.
Great! They bought it! Now let's move it and light this place up!
(Plot lines for Tomes Brano [COM], HQ strand, Scene 4)

Hey, I'm told you're the Boron liaison guy. The Yaki have appeared to have given up raiding Bala Gi's labs but they did manage to steal some high-level stuff. It's likely they want to reverse-engineer some of the technology, so we need to investigate their sectors. We need you to take a look around in Ocracoke's Storm. Take out any enhanced ships you can find. Good luck.

Good to see you back in one piece. Looking at this data you collected, I'd bet my left cahoona that the station surrounded by mines is what we're looking for. It's likely to be where they're researching the tech they stole. None of the other sectors contained anything nearly as interesting for us to blow up. This station is of particular interest, if you catch my drift. The bulk of the fleet is standing by, just take out those mines and we'll head on in.
Great work, pilot. Humi Wi has requested that you speak with him immediately. He is in Kingdom End.
(Do not speak - Tutorial lines for Instructor pilot [COM])
Hello. Would you like to learn the basics of flying?
Good. If you want to stop at any time then just tell me. You can contact me through the Comm Menu. Let's cover the basics first: Movement.
Accelerate to 10 metres per second by pressing the acceleration key.
If you hold the decelerate button you will reverse. Reverse to minus 5 metres per second.
I have ejected a crate, it's next to me.
Now target me and open the Communication Menu.
This is the main form of interaction with objects. You can command ships, request docking permission or ask for directions by opening up the Communication Menu.
At stations you will be able to trade goods, look for missions and upgrade ships. (Pause)Now undock from the station.
I have ejected another crate close by.
You can use missiles too. Target the crate, select a missile and launch.
Look at your shield indicator. If you are hit your shields will reduce. Once your shield energy is depleted your hull will start to take damage. Shields will regenerate automatically, hull will not.
Be careful as there are some weapons which are designed to bypass shields, lower shields or disrupt systems.
Well done, I think you have the basics. You will pick up the rest as you go.

page.title: Argon/Terran Male Variation 2
page.t: Hey! You're either blind or stupid; maybe both.
I won't say this again, stand down.
This is your last chance - break it off.
You just crossed the line, make your peace.
Vessel under attack, require immediate assistance.
I hope you choke on my waste pipe!
Look, I'll give you anything! Anything!
Losing hull integrity. Son of a...!
I'll see you on the other side! Arrrgh!
Pilot, you clearly have no idea how close you are to death. Stand down.
Your ignorance astounds me. Cease fire.
Weapons systems are now locked. Any last requests?
Not a good time right now.
You're not going to get any data from me.
Do you have any idea what you're saying!?
That's great! Just what I needed!
No more! I'm bailing out! She's yours!
Comms channel open. This is the Commander. What do you require?
You'd better hope those shields hold. I'm all kinds of angry!
Get off my comms channel! I'm busy!
Got nothing to say to you, pilot. Not now. Not ever.
Surrender? Put down the spaceweed, pilot. Step away from the spaceweed.
Sure, set your navcom to head for the
You're pretty much where you want to be, dummy.
No clue. I'm out cold on that one.
Of course, it's the least we can do. Mark waypoints for the
It's been an honour to assist you.
Sector Patrol to pilot. Your cargo is contraband. Unload immediately.
Final warning, drop your wares or you will be fired upon.
This isn't the vessel we're looking for. Carry on.
I'm not getting any younger here!
I'm through with you, we part ways at your next docking point.
I've been waiting for you for some time now. Time to drop that freight.
Ohhh, not all at once, to be sure.
I have you in my sights, (dark mutter)don't play with me...
Calling in support, need a little more metal on this nutcase!
Not this time, you're on your own!
Sure, I could use the practice!
(curses)How can anyone as ugly as you only have one head?
Setting course to engage the enemy!
Losing my shields! Can't take this!
I'm taking damage to my hull!
They're all over me! Too many to count!
I'm looking forward to writing your obituary.
(fleeing)The heat's a little too much, I'm outta here!
I've got a lead you might like to pick up on.
I need someone who can handle combat.
I need a courier to transport some wares for me.
I have a mark I need neutralised.
There's a passenger I need moving.
I've got to make tracks out of here, fast.
I need someone to construct a station for me.
I'm looking for someone to deliver a few items to me.
Yeah, I've always got work for you.
Hey there's another job for you.
Anything there you find of interest?
Want to get the low-down on the job?
Reckon you can take the job?
This is what we're in need of.
This mission should be a cake-walk for you.
You might find things a little tricky.
You may see some heavy challenges in this mission.
This mission won't take you that long.
You're going to be spending some time on this job.
You'll need to keep your eyes open for sector patrols during the mission.
Stay frosty, you'll need to watch for enemies during the mission.
Great work, wouldn't have been able to do it without you.
You did some fantastic work there.
I reckon that will have to do. You could do with a little improvement though.
Sending payment for the job now.
(Mission Failed)You're a joke. Get out of my sight.
(Mission Failed Mid Mission)You failed. This mission is over!
What the? You're skipping out on me!?
(Time Update)You're on a timer here and it's ticking down.
Are you completely crazy!? What's got into you!?
Sorry, I need someone a little less wet behind the ears.
You'll need a ship with combat capability for this.
You'll need a ship with decent cargo capacity for this.
You'll need a transporter device installed.
Stop your grinnin' and go get one!
(Passenger on board)Get me to my destination, now!
I want off this ship. Now!
(Passenger getting off)Appreciate the ride. See you around!
(No room)You think I'm going to fit in there? Think again!
And just how am I supposed to breathe? Get cargo life support!
You think I'm going to jump in that piece of junk? Get a passenger transport.
Your ship is as empty as your head. Get some equipment installed.
Your wares are being transferred now.
Move to intercept and destroy all bogeys.
Fall back, we need to regroup at the Command Base!
Looks like you could use a hand. Let's say we smoke these bogeys.
We have support ships arriving through the (gate)
Look sharp! Enemy ships inbound through the (gate)
Great work. Get your ship to base for repairs.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Check your scanners! We have incoming (933-936)
Keep your eyes sharp, mines in this area!
We need cover. Keep your eyes sharp.
You're going to need to lose some cargo, you're out of space.
Dock so I can load your cargo.
I can't risk open comms. Dock and we'll exchange data.
Dock the ship at this station, pilot.
Time's running out! Get on with it!
Get your ship into dock, pilot.
You're not close enough where you are, move in a little.
Roll back that vector! You're too close!
Sorry, I'm out of work for you.
Your work has not gone unnoticed. We thank you and offer you a token of gratitude. Use it well.
Our scans show you're carrying an unregistered life-form. Release the passenger immediately!
Fine, if you change your mind, you know where I am.
What are you doing back there?
I'm bringing the prices up now.
Terracorp's looking for someone to work for us.
Terracorp has some work for you.
Terracorp offers this token of our appreciation for your continued service.
Please accept this token of Terracorp's gratitude for your service.
Jonferco is looking for someone to do some jobs for us.
We are looking for someone to work for Jonferco.
Please accept this for your continued service to Jonferco.
Jonferco would like to offer this gift for your continued service.
OTAS(speak Oh-Tass) are looking for someone to work for us.
OTAS has regular work for someone like you.
Your loyalty to OTAS is recognised with this gift.
OTAS offers you this reward for your continued service.
Plutarch is looking for someone to do some work for us.
Plutarch has regular work for a pilot like you.
Plutarch recognises your loyal service with this reward.
Plutarch offers you this as a reward for your continued service.
(Goner priest)These aren't the droids, errr, (cough)wares you're looking for... you can continue.
The chances of anything coming from Mars are a... oh, 1 to 1.
Allow me to perform the Goner Mine Meld... My mine to your mine, my supports to your supports...

Hurry up, boy. Don't slack. We've got to be at our best. That goes for everyone. The Terran diplomats' transport will be here in a few minutes. Xenon activity has been on the increase, especially near the Terran border. The mission should be uneventful unless the Xenon decide to crash the party. Check your systems and form up.
Terran Transport is inbound. Loading mission guidance information to your head-up display.
Yes, Ma'am. We'll be looking after you guys on your trip home.
(under his breath)Arrogant little... ( to escort group)Let's move out.
Latest reports indicate there are no Xenon on our flight path.
With respect, Ma'am, your scanners have a slightly larger range while ours offer clearer information. If the Xenon jump in, you won't be able to tell if it's a ship or rock any faster than we can.

All of these pilots have had experience fighting the Xenon. I can't imagine any of them wanting the job though. No offence, but side-switching is not part of Argon character. I think we're done here. Good day, Ma'am.

page.title: Argon/Terran Female Variation 1
page.t: Do I look like Yaki? Cut it out!
I don't take kindly to your attention, pilot. Arming weapons.
Damage my wares and I'll be sure to damage yours.
Engaging attack vector, you're marked and sparked.
I'm taking damage! Request immediate assistance!
Hey! I didn't mean it. Please stop!
Your targeting systems appear to be malfunctioning. Stand down!
Chikusho! Pilot, I have weapons locked! Final warning!
We're locked onto you. Ah, what a sweet tone!
I'm fresh out of time, catch up later.
Sorry I can't give you data on that.
You may be cute, but you're all kinds of stupid!
Did you leave your brains in quarantine, pilot?
Shiny! A new target for testing my weapons!
Punching out. I'll find you..(cold)I swear I'll have my revenge.
Cargo's in the pipe. Now get bent!
You had better have a damn good reason for this call, pilot.
I'm about done talking, sweetcheeks. Not done fighting though.
Chikusho! I'm BUSY! No time for smalltalk!
Yeah, I'd like to help you, but that's not going to happen anytime soon.
Pilot, I fought the Kha'ak at Omicron Lyrae. Surrender? Never.
Pretty little thing, but clearly not the brightest. You're already there!
That doesn't register on my nav-charts. Sorry.
Pleased to help. Head towards the
Should you ever need anything else, you know where I'll be.
Sector Security, stop your engines and drop your wares!
I won't say this again, you're carrying illegals. Drop them or I fire.
This is Sector Security, you're in the clear. Enjoy your flight.
Chikusho! What is this, a pleasure-cruise? My ma flies faster than you!
I want the hell off this piece of junk, I'm punching out next stop.
Shiny! That freight would look great in my hold!
That's my baby. Come to mama.
Oh that's really not enough to satisfy me, (purrs)drop more, more...
Need a little covering fire, this one's got a little bite!
Nah, I want to see you shoot it out solo for once.
On my way!.. Chikusho! You talk too much and fight too little.
Chikusho, you're as ugly as you are stupid.
(curses)You fight like you want to die!
They're coming in from all angles!
Not good! Not good! Hull's being breached!
They're tied to my six. Can't break out!
Reactor's punching critical mass, she's going to blow!
I can't even count them! Too many!
Mark one up for the princess!
I'd love to hear you scream my name as your ship burns.
Thinning out! It would be a waste to end it here, like this.
This isn't working out how I thought it would. Dropping out!
Missile has spiked, it's got me!
(prefix to 803 )Cutting things close, but you made it!
There's work that might fit you well.
I'm looking for a combat veteran.
I need a ship, a good one.
I need someone to pick up some cargo for me.
(protection mission)I need someone to watch my six.
I'm in need of a freighter pilot.
Got a mark I need taken care of.
I've got a fare needing transport.
I'm looking to hitch a ride.
I need to get the frick' out of here, fast!.
I need someone capable of building a station for me.
I'm going to need you to deliver some wares.
I need a trace put out on someone.
I'm looking for someone willing to work for me.
Looks like I might be able to offer you something!
Want to see the specs of the job?
You going to give me a green light on the job?
We're going to need these things.
This mission shouldn't be an issue for you.
This might make you sweat a little.
You might find things a little heavy.
You're in for the long haul on this one.
Watch your six for police during the mission.
Keep your head down and watch for enemies on this mission.
Excellent, no way I would have done it without you.
You did good here, real good.
Your help made all the difference.
Thanks again, you're pretty much my number one!
I guess that will have to do. Need to try a little harder though.
Wiring your money through to you now.
You suck, badly. Get the hell out out of here!
Hey!? Where d'you think you're going? We're not done here!
Take a look at your guidance system, pilot!
You're coming up short on the ticker, move it!
What gives!? You've lost it! Completely lost it!
No can do, I need someone with experience.
You'll need a ship hardened for combat for this.
Got to have a transport ship for this one.
Transporter device is essential for this.
See that thruster control? Why won't you frickin' use it?
Let me out of this hunk of junk!
Thanks for getting me here safely!
I may be small, but are you crazy? I can't fit onboard!
You think I'm going to hold my breath? Get a cargo life support system!
No way - you either get a passenger transport or the deal is off.
We need more. Awaiting further deliveries.
I've seen Goner better prepared. Get some equipment.
You think this is okay? Look at me! It is NOT okay! Chikusho!
Mark your intercept course and clear out all hostiles.
Drop back! Regroup at our command base!
Punching through and weapons free. Reinforcement have arrived!
Shiny! Additional firepower heading in through the (gate)
Well, if it ain't the cavalry! Great to have you with us!
Heads up, people! Enemy ships heading in through the (gate)
Shiny! Push through to base for any repairs you need.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Stop your grinnin' and drop your linen! We got incoming (933-936)
We have mines in range, evasive manoeuvres!
What are you, nuts? You're out of space. Drop some cargo.
You'll need to dock here so I can deliver the wares you require.
I don't want this out in the open. Dock and we'll deliver the data.
Great! You've got the ship! Dock over here!
Is there a reason you're taking your time? Get it done!
You don't have range yet, push forwards a little!
Sorry, there's nothing lined up for you right now.
You honour us with your loyal service. We wish to reward you for your efforts.
Sector Security here. You appear to be carrying an illegal passenger. We demand immediate release or we'll take action!
Please come back later if you have a change of heart.
That's not something you want to repeat!
Hey, don't worry. Have another try.
That's the way to do it!
Terracorp is on the look-out for someone to work for us.
There are regular jobs available for Terracorp.
Terracorp offers this token of our appreciation for your continued service.
Please accept this token of Terracorp's gratitude for your service.
Jonferco needs someone to do some jobs for us.
We're looking for someone to do some regular work for Jonferco.
Please take this as a reward for your continued service to Jonferco.
Jonferco would like you to take this gift for your continued service.
OTAS(speak Oh-Tas) needs you! We have regular work for you, pilot.
Sweet! OTAS has regular work for someone like you.
Your loyal service to OTAS should be rewarded... take this gift.
OTAS insists that you take this for your continued service.
Regular work is available at Plutarch... just say the word, pilot!
Plutarch has regular work for a pilot like you.
Thanks for your continued service to Plutarch, pilot. Please accept this.
Plutarch offers you this gift as a reward for your diligent service.
Does my gun look big in this?
This is Terran Transport T9-Alpha en route to sector Heretic's End. I understand you are our escort.
I hope you are all better than our last escort group. I was under the impression that the Argon military are a bunch of jokers. Iovis out.
No AGI detected in the vicinity. We'll let you know if we see any.
Confirmed. It looks like a small attack group. They're on to us!
That's the last of them. Damn AGI. They always send a shiver down my spine. Resetting course for Heretic's End.

Thank you for the escort. You guys were not that bad. Come to think of it, we could use some of you. AGI, that's Xenon to you, I guess, have been attacking this sector for the last month. The USC and ATF are holding out fine but anyone with experience fighting the Xenon would be of great use to us. Lieutenant Gellet, do you have anyone in mind?

How about you, pilot? You handled yourself well out there. The USC is not really any different to the Argon Military except that you will be treated as an emissary and will receive access to many of our superior technologies. Contact me if you are interested.

That's great news! The USC have granted you basic access to the Solar System. I'm sure your background and connections in the Commonwealth will be very useful to us. Proceed to Uranus sector. Your first mission is there.

page.title: Argon/Terran female Variation 2
page.t: I'd better be in your sights for a reason, pilot. Stand down!
You're close to finding yourself in a world of pain.
You think I travel alone or unguarded? Think again.
I'm done talking, pilot. Not done fighting though. Hell no!
I'm under fire! Under fire! Need fighter support!
I'll spread your ashes across the sectors!
Systems failing, you gotta give me a chance!
I'm breaking apart here! Stand down! Stand down!
If you're looking for a fight, keep pushing, pilot.
You're flying on borrowed time. Don't force me to give the order!
Do I look like I frickin' care? Bite me!
Not able to deal with you now, patch in to me another time.
That's not something I can help with.
You want me to what? You're kidding right? Am I on a CamShow?!
Say again. I was laughing so hard I missed that last part.
Those better not be scorch-marks on my hull!
Take her! Just get the hell off my six! I'm done fighting!
Cargo coming your way. Now break it off!
Force Commander online. What do you require?
Sweet-talk all you want, you'll be smouldering fire when I'm done.
No time. Leave your ID; if you're cute, I'll check in later.
You're going to have to figure that out on your own.
You would be wise to watch your mouth, my patience wears thin.
You'll need to set up a vector for the
It looks like you're already there. Been on the space fuel again?
I haven't got a clue where you're talking about, sorry!
Your reputation precedes you, we will direct you towards the
You honour me with your presence.
This is Sector Patrol, your cargo is hot! Drop the illegals now!
Arming weapons, comply or you will be fired upon!
Scans confirm you're clean and good to go. Thank you for your cooperation.
Don't care how long you keep me onboard, neeeeever gonna happen.
That's quite enough, I'm done flying with you.
Let me lighten your load a little. Drop your shields and let's party.
That's a start. Now show me a little more, sweetcheeks.
(cold)I don't want to have to hurt you.. so drop the wares, (hard)NOW!
Oh great! Now you decide to fight back! Calling for support!
Really don't think so. This one's all yours.
Setting intercept course. I'm on the way.
Is that your ship exhaust or your breath!?
You're nothing more than a weedhead.
(bye, spoken warmly,softly)See you on the other side...
I have been blessed, thank you.
They're on my six, can't shake them!!
Reactor's reaching critical, about to blow!
Now that's what I call a kill!
I'll bring you to your knees and make you beg for your life.
(fleeing)You're too cute to kill and I'm too hot to die. Bugging out.
Got a mike on my six!
This missile's got a solid tone on me!
(prefix to 803 )I'm so happy to speak to you.
I have a job that's perfect for you.
I need someone who knows how to handle a ship and weaponry.
I need a ship, tough and fast.
I'm looking for a courier to bring me some wares.
I need a wingman, strictly protection and cover.
Looking for someone who can handle a freighter.
I need someone taken care of, (pronounced capeesh)capisce?
I've got a passenger in need of a ride.
I need to hitch a ride with someone, reckon you could take me?
You have to get me out of here, fast! Please, I need a ride!
I've been looking for someone to build me a station. You got the gear?
I'm going to need you to ship some items.
I need a bio-lock on someone... I want a confirmed find.
Hey I'm looking for someone to work for me, think you could stick it?
Yes, I've got something you can do.
I'm in need of a little help here.
D'you want to take a run through the details?
Stop gawking! You want the job or not?
Here's the itinerary. This is what we need.
You'll walk through this no problem.
There might be a few bumps on this one.
You're going to take some heat on this mission.
You won't be done with this for a while, have patience.
You'll have enemies on the lookout for you during this mission.
Check your six for police during this mission.
Check your six for enemies during this mission.
Amazing! Wouldn't have closed this one out without you!
You make me proud, real proud! Great work!
Thanks for your help with this one!
Great! Your work is without fault, as usual.
I reckon that will have to do. Make a little more effort next time?
What the hell was that? You failed. Get the hell out of my sight.
Aborting! This mission is over, moron!
Great! I have a damn coward on my hands! That's it! You BETTER run!
Take a look through your charts, pilot!
You're on the clock and it's running down fast!
Shoot, that's it. You're through, out of time.
Think that's funny!? That's coming straight out of your pay!
Nothing happening! I want someone with stones.
You need a fully-prepped combat ship for this.
You need a fully-prepped transporter for this.
You'll need a jumpdrive for this mission.
Without a transporter device, nothing happening.
(Passenger on board)Punch it! Get me where I want to be!
We're losing precious time here! Get there already!
I'm through with this, let me off your ship.
We made it! Thanks for the ride!
There's no way I'm going to fit in your hold!
Do I look like Xenon? Get a cargo life support system!
What? You want me to fly with you in that? Get a passenger transport!
Your delivery is confirmed. Great work!
Still need more. Awaiting further shipments.
Your ship's a little empty. Grab some equipment.
What happened here? You think this is in any way acceptable? Think again.
Set your intercept vector and neutralise all hostiles.
We need to regroup! Fall back and head for the Command Base!
Someone call for a little extra fire? Light 'em up, we'll put 'em out.
Great! We have more ships punching in through the (gate)
Really glad to have you with us!
Make like you've got a plan! Enemy ships inbound through the (gate)
Great job! Move to base and get your repairs.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Whole heap of pain coming our way, incoming (933-936)
Mines in sector, watch your vector!
I'll need your protection. Watch my six.
Unload some wares, you're out of space.
I can't deliver your cargo until you're docked.
You won't get anything until you're docked. I'll deliver the data when I see you.
Amazing! You have the ship! Dock it at this station please!
Is there something you're waiting for? Get on with it!
Lay in an approach vector and dock your ship, pilot.
You're out too far, move in a little closer!
Push back! You're in too deep!
I'm out of leads, pilot. Nothing, nada, zilch! Now scram!
Your efforts have not gone unnoticed. Please accept this reward.
Sector Security here. An unregistered passenger has been detected on your ship. Release him or we'll take action.
Come back and see me if you have a rethink.
Try again. Really, it's not a problem.
Chikusho! Now that's how you do it!
I suggest you stop following me!
Terracorp has work available for you.
If you want regular work, then join Terracorp!
Please accept this token of Terracorp's appreciation for your continued service.
Please take this token of Terracorp's gratitude for your loyal service.
Jonferco has regular work for you, if you're interested.
We're on the look-out for pilots to do some regular work for Jonferco.
Please accept this for your continued service to Jonferco.
Don't upset us by declining this gift for your loyal service.
OTAS(speak Oh-Tass) has regular work for you, pilot.
OTAS has regular work for pilots like you.
Your diligent work for OTAS hasn't gone unnoticed... please accept this gift.
OTAS insists on rewarding your continued service.
There's regular work at Plutarch... look no further, pilot!
Plutarch has regular work for a pilot like you.
Plutarch thanks you, pilot. Please accept this for your loyal service.
Plutarch rewards loyalty and efficiency. Please accept this for your diligent service.
I found my thrill on Aladna Hill.

page.title: Terran Border Patrol
page.t: Attention pilot, this is Terran Border Security. You are not authorised to enter our sectors. Leave immediately. Failure to comply will result in lethal force being used against you. You have one minute to reverse course and leave.
You have failed to comply with our instruction to leave our sectors. We are authorised to open fire. Prepare to be terminated.
Pilot, this is AGI Task Force Border Control. You are not permitted to approach or enter the Earth sector. You are to reverse course immediately or we will force you to do so.
Pilot, this is Terran Border Control. You are not permitted to enter this sector. You are to reverse course immediately or we will force you to do so.
Pilot, this is ATF Earth Sector Security. You appear to be deviating from permitted flight paths. Maintain the correct course and speed for transit.
This is Earth Torus Control. You are to return to the designated transit area immediately. Your ship is being tracked by Torus weapons systems. No further deviation will be tolerated.
Contrary to our instructions, you have continued to deviate from the permitted trajectory. You are now considered an enemy vessel. Torus main guns are powered up and have orders to destroy you.
Warning! You are entering restricted military space. Reverse course immediately.

page.title: Argon Border Patrol
page.t: Pilot, this is Argon Security. Leave this sector immediately. Your current status prohibits you from entering our core sectors. Failure to leave will result in lethal force being directed against you. You have one minute to comply.
You have failed to comply with our order to leave our sectors. Attack vector authorised. Prepare to be eliminated.
Warning! You are entering restricted military space. Reverse course immediately.

page.title: Boron Variation 1
page.t: Boron have no quarrel with you.
Boron will have no choice but to oppose your actions!
Your attack forces us to oppose. Your chance for peace is fading.
No sympathy will we have for your demise.
Our ship comes under attack! Save us!
We have little left but our lives, Menelaus save us!
We have detected weapons fire from your ship. Show care!
We offer a final warning to you. Do not persist!
Our orders are confirmed. You will die now.
I have nothing to offer you right now.
We hold no weight in this matter.
I shall do no such thing.
I'm in no mood to comply with your demands.
I wish to leave unhindered. My ship is yours.
I wish for no more of this! Take my cargo!
The Boron accept your communication. Please go ahead.
Your threats mean nothing! Menelaus shall protect us!
I have no time for your thoughts. Perhaps later.
The Queen's counsel forbids our communication with you.
Surrender? Truly your stupidity knows no bounds.
We would suggest you set thrusters in the direction of the
Your coordinates suggest you are already there, pilot.
We have no knowledge of that which you seek.
May you be graced in all your travels, make haste to the
Boron Sector patrol to pilot, you carry illegal wares. Drop them immediately.
Pilot, you will comply or we will be forced to fire.
Boron Sector Patrol confirms you have no illegal goods onboard. We thank you.
You fly as if without water. Please hurry!
I wish to fly with you no longer. You bore me. I will leave shortly.
I feel the need for greed. Your freight will be mine!
Just one? Surely you can do better!
Help! I cannot take this one without support!
We do not wish to interfere. This fight is yours alone.
It will be good to see this one burn.
I am under attack! Save me!
Our shields will not protect us for much longer!
My hull is taking great damage!
It seems the reactor is about to explode!
Unable to establish exact count, too many!
Your world will not miss you, neither will I.
(fleeing)No more! This will end badly! I must leave!
(prefix to 803 )I am happy for your contact.
(generic job)We have work you may wish to consider.
(combat mission)I need a pilot who can fight, and fight well.
(I need a ship)I am looking for a ship, worthy of the Queen!
I require your aid in the delivery of some items.
(protection mission)I require protection of the highest quality.
I require the services of a freighter pilot.
We require someone to be, how shall we say it, disposed of.
I have a passenger who is in dire need of transport.
I must leave here, as fast as possible.
I require the skills of a station-builder.
I need a courier. Pick up and deliver.
I require someone to work for me.
Yes, I do believe I have another job for you.
Do you feel I have something of interest?
Would you wish to see the details?
Do you wish to take the job?
I am transmitting the information you require now.
I am sending the details you require now.
This mission will be far from difficult.
This mission may offer you some challenges.
This mission may prove to be tougher than others.
This mission has little that should concern you.
This mission has no quick conclusion, have patience.
You must expect hostile forces along your route.
Please steer clear of police during this mission.
Please steer clear of enemies during this mission.
You have my gratitude, this would not have been possible without you.
I thank you for your assistance.
As usual your work is exemplary. I thank you.
This is enough. Your efforts are sadly lacking, try harder next time.
I am sending your money now.
That was appalling! Get out of here! Leave me!
You have failed to satisfy my requirements! This mission is over!
Where do you run to? Coward!
Time is a luxury you do not have.
Your time has come to an end.
What do you think you are doing? Are you insane?
Forgive me, I wanted a pilot of greater experience.
You will require a combat ship in order to service my needs.
You will require a transport ship in order to service my needs.
You will need to obtain a jumpdrive.
You will need to obtain a transporter device.
What are you waiting for? Please obtain one now!
Please take me to my destination!
You must hurry, my tentacles are drying out!
I see no future in staying with you, allow me to depart your ship.
Our journey ends gracefully. Thank you!
My tentacles will crack! I need more space!
I will not survive without a cargo life support system.
I have no time for jokes! I will fly in a passenger transport only.
More is needed. We await further shipments.
Prior preparation prevents poor performance, pilot!
You should be receiving your wares now.
This is far from acceptable, pilot. We are not amused.
Make your intercept run and destroy all enemy targets.
We are being overrun! We must regroup at HQ!
We see that you are in need of a little extra. We are that extra.
We see support ships moving in through the (gate)
Queen's grace! We are happy to have you with us!
We appear to have enemy ships incoming through the (gate)
We praise you. Continue to base for repairs.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
There are mines ahead, please be careful!
We ask that you protect us from all enemies.
We ask you to unload cargo, you have no space for more wares.
We respectfully ask you to dock for the transfer of cargo.
The sea hears us. Dock and then the data will be yours.
You grace us with this ship! Please dock it at this station.
Does something delay you? Please hurry!
You will need to dock your ship.
We would ask you to move closer.
Move away! You are too close!
We have no work suited to your talents at this time.
The Queen chooses to recognise your work. Please take this with our gratitude.
Boron security scans reveal an illegal passenger on your ship. Immediate release is advised.
Please return if you change your mind.
Very well. You should try again, perhaps.
Very good. I think you've done it!
That's how it should be done!
Atreus has work available for you.
Regular work awaits you at Atreus, pilot.
Please accept this token of Atreus' appreciation for your continued service.
Please take this token of Atreus' gratitude for your loyal service.
(Do not speak - Tutorial lines for Instructor pilot [COM])
Peace, friend. Would you like to learn the basics of flying?
Good. If you want to stop at any time then just tell me. You can contact me through the Comm Menu. Let's cover the basics first: Movement.
Accelerate to 10 metres per second by pressing the acceleration key.
If you hold the decelerate button you will reverse. Reverse to minus 5 metres per second.
I have ejected a crate, it's next to me.
Now target me and open the Communication Menu.
This is the main form of interaction with objects. You can command ships, request docking permission or ask for directions by opening up the Communication Menu.
At stations you will be able to trade goods, look for missions and upgrade ships. (Pause)Now undock from the station.
I have ejected another crate close by.
You can use missiles too. Target the crate, select a missile and launch.
Look at your shield indicator. If you are hit your shields will reduce. Once your shield energy is depleted your hull will start to take damage. Shields will regenerate automatically, hull will not.
Be careful as there are some weapons which are designed to bypass shields, lower shields or disrupt systems.
You have worked well and I think you have the basics. You have much more to learn out there in the deep.

page.title: Boron Variation 2
page.t: Your aggression is hopefully a mistake, pilot.
Boron peaceful, but not unarmed. You have chance yet for peace.
Please go. We do not wish to end our lives in conflict.
Our weapons will now defend against your aggression.
Boron vessel under fire, request help! Anyone!
By the Queen's grace you shall die!
Menelaus save us! We offer no anger!
You fire upon us! We hope by mistake!
You have but one chance to retreat... or die.
You breach our peace, we breach your hull.
Our time is limited and our waters low. Try later.
I have no words for you, pilot.
This does not concern the Boron.
You ask such strange things of the Boron.
We will not allow your actions to pass unpunished.
You have my ship. Leave me be.
I have no wish to fight. Here, take my cargo.
You have the Commander's attention. State your business.
You have such hatred within you. It is good that you die.
We are too busy to offer response.
We have little to say to you... less to offer.
There is no logic in your request. Your humour does not please us.
We ask that you turn to the
You are already where you wish to be.
Those waters are unknown to us.
Menelaus blesses your journey towards the
We see that you have illegal wares. These you must drop!
Please release your illegal cargo. Or we will fire upon your ship!
We detect no illegal goods aboard. Menelaus protect you in your travels.
Do you know where you are or that I am with you? Make haste!
Travel with you is pointless. I will leave at your next dock.
You have much of what I need... much of what I want!
You taunt me! More! There is more I know!
This one cares not for the Queen! Help in my battle!
I choose not to engage. This one is yours!
I will assist. Let us share the spoils!
I am under attack! Evasion has failed!
We lose our shields, we lose everything!
My ship's hull is under attack!
Enemies are bound to my rear. I cannot shake them!
The reactor has reached critical mass, it will soon explode!
There are too many! I cannot count!
Doom chases me! There is a missile!
